title: Friday morning news briefing: Will Jeremy Corbyn 'end this nightmare'?
text:
If you want to receive twice-daily briefings like this by email, sign up to the Front Page newsletter here and try our Audio Briefings on WhatsApp.

Brexit delay decision expected as Boris Johnson calls for vote

He is calling their bluff. Boris Johnson has challenged Jeremy Corbyn to "end this nightmare" by agreeing to an election on December 12. The Prime Minister said that if MPs agreed to the pre-Christmas poll, he would reintroduce his Brexit Bill and give Parliament until November 6 to pass it. As Gordon Rayner reports, Mr Johnson has threatened to effectively mothball Parliamentif a vote on a snap poll on Monday fails. It means he has finally abandoned his "do or die" pledge to get Britain out of the EU by October 31 - and has left Jeremy Corbyn's party in disarray. With EU leaders expected to announce a decision over a Brexit delay today, Anna Mikhailova and Christopher Hopehave a full recap of how Mr Johnson put the ball in Labour's court.

Mr Johnson is trying to enjoy the best of both worlds. By offering both more time and an election, Daniel Capurro analyses how the PM is playing it clever. So might a win be comfortable for the Conservatives? Follow the latest election odds and our polls tracker. And Matt considers the most important issue in today's cartoon: the impact a December election might have on Christmas.
description: If you want to receive twice-daily briefings like this by email, sign up to the Front Page newsletter here and try our Audio Briefings on WhatsApp.
